lines.text: Ich bin lange weg und komm nach Hause mit Croissants (ah)
lines.translation: I've been away for a long time and I come home with croissants (ah)
lines.grammar: mit (3sg/2pl present); nach → dative (to/after); mit → dative (with); Meaning: 'I've been away for a long time and I come home with croissants (ah)'; Remember V2 word order; separable prefixes often sit at the end; cases follow the given prepositions.

lines.text: Denn ich fahr um 7 Uhr heim nach 'ner crazy Night (skrrt)
lines.translation: Because I'm driving home at 7 o'clock after a crazy night (skrrt)
lines.grammar: skrrt (3sg/2pl present); um → accusative (around); nach → dative (to/after); Meaning: 'Because I'm driving home at 7 o'clock after a crazy night (skrrt)'; Remember V2 word order; separable prefixes often sit at the end; cases follow the given prepositions.

lines.translation: I worked all night and yeah, I was turned on.

lines.translation: The room was full of smoke, I can feel it in my airways.
lines.grammar: in → acc (into) / dat (in); Meaning: 'The room was full of smoke, I can feel it in my airways.'; Remember V2 word order; separable prefixes often sit at the end; cases follow the given prepositions.

lines.text: Die Sonne geht auf und die Birds sind der Wecker, um dem Trapper zur erzählen (ja)
lines.translation: The sun rises and the birds are the alarm clock to tell the trapper (yes)
lines.grammar: geht (3sg/2pl present), erzählen (infinitive/plural); auf → acc (onto) / dat (on); um → accusative (around); Meaning: 'The sun rises and the birds are the alarm clock to tell the trapper (yes)'; Remember V2 word order; separable prefixes often sit at the end; cases follow the given prepositions.
